qas.question: What aids in predicting changes of physical traits?
What stage of a physical transformation can group theory be used to make prediction?
What temperature causes the change of ferroelectric materials?
What term describes the vibrational lattice mode that turns to 0 frequency at the change?
What predicts the changes in group theory?
Which stage can physical properties be used to make predictions about group theory?
What temperature causes a change from ferroelectric to paraelectric?
What is the frequency of a paraelectric state before transition?
What is the name of the mode that moves material from a low-symmetry state to a high one?

context: Likewise, <a0_0>group theory<a0_0/> helps predict the changes in <b4_0>physical properties<b4_0/> that occur when a material undergoes <b5_0>a <a1_0>phase transition<b5_0/><a1_0/>, for example, from a cubic to a tetrahedral crystalline form. An example is ferroelectric materials, where the change from a paraelectric to a ferroelectric state occurs at the <a2_0><b6_0>Curie temperature<b6_0/><a2_0/> and is related to a change from the high-symmetry paraelectric state to the lower symmetry ferroelectic state, accompanied by a so-called <a3_0><b8_0>soft phonon mode<b8_0/><a3_0/>, a vibrational lattice mode that goes to <b7_0>zero<b7_0/> frequency at the transition.
